unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of smart electricity meters is picking up pace, with significant progress reported in several states, according to the Ministry of Power. The initiative, aimed at reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses and improving billing efficiency, has seen over 5 million smart meters installed as of 10/26/2023.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of smart electricity meters is picking up pace, with significant progress reported in several states, according to the Ministry of Power. The initiative, aimed at reducing Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses and improving billing efficiency, has seen over five million smart meters installed as of twenty sixth october two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: Maharashtra, Gujarat, and Uttar Pradesh are leading the charge, with plans to install millions more by 2025. The deployment is part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), a central government initiative with an outlay of Rs. 3.03 lakh crore. Concerns regarding data privacy and meter costs are being addressed through stringent security protocols and bulk procurement strategies.
normalised: Maharashtra, Gujarat, and Uttar Pradesh are leading the charge, with plans to install millions more by two thousand and twenty five. The deployment is part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), a central government initiative with an outlay of rupee three point zero three lakh crore. Concerns regarding data privacy and meter costs are being addressed through stringent security protocols and bulk procurement strategies.

unnormalised: "Smart meters are crucial for building a modern and efficient power distribution network," stated Mr. Sharma, Director, Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL), at a conference held at IIT Bombay on 10/27/2023 at 14:00 hrs. The system allows for real-time monitoring and control, enabling consumers to manage their electricity consumption effectively. The project is expected to improve the financial health of DISCOMs and ensure 24x7 reliable power supply by 15/08/2024, in line with the government's vision.
